definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: The now-infamous" Wand Order Problem" was corrected in later editions of the book.
sentences.chinese: 目前身名狼藉的“魔杖倒序问题”在再版中被更正了。

sentences.english: These columns can be sorted in ascending or descending order.
sentences.chinese: 这些列可以按正序或倒序排序。

sentences.english: If no specific guidelines are recommended for a particular country, use reverse- chronology .
sentences.chinese: 如果某一个国家没有特殊的要求，最好使用倒序型。

sentences.english: All of your friends' activities will be listed in chronological order.
sentences.chinese: 您所有朋友的活动都会按照倒序顺序排列。

definition: to flash back/flashback (in a novel, movie etc)
tab window (in a web browser etc)/paging/pagination/page break (computing)
